DataElement.preferredName: Antibiotic Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study related to the administration of substances used in the treatment of bacterial and other microbial infections.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Antibiotic Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A substance that kills microorganisms such as bacteria or mold, or stops them from growing and causing disease._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (an-tih-by-AH-tik) A drug used to treat infections caused by bacteria and other microorganisms.

Concepts.definition: Substances naturally produced by microorganisms or their derivatives that selectively target microorganisms not humans. Antibiotics kill or inhibit the growth of microorganisms by targeting components of the microbial cell absent from human cells, including bacterial cell walls, cell membrane, and 30S or 50S ribosomal subunits. These substances are used in the treatment of bacterial and other microbial infections.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received oral or
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received oral or intravenous (IV) antibiotics within 2 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received oral or intravenous (IV) antibiotics within 2 weeks prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received oral or intravenous (IV) antibiotics within 2 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received oral or intravenous (IV) antibiotics within 2 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1, unless patient is receiving prophylactic antibiotics (e.g., for prevention of a urinary tract infection or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received oral or intravenous antibiotics within 1 week of study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received oral or intravenous (IV) antibiotics within 2 weeks prior to registration? Patients receiving prophylactic antibiotics (e.g., for prevention of a urinary tract infection or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease) are eligible.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received oral or intravenous (IV) antibiotics within 2 weeks prior to registration?
